result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Kozlowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft >$2500-$5000], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution payable to MARK W. for $23,410.43 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 10-19-2017 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 1 (ONE) days served; Huber privileges. Court recommends against electronic monitoring. Report by 11-02-2015 by 5pm. Failure to report will result in a straight time sentence.
Court does not suspend driving privileges.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Kozlowski in court with attorney Victor E Plantinga.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by Mark W.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 120 (ONE HUNDRED TWENTY) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 1 (ONE) days served; Huber privileges. Court recommends against electronic monitoring. Report by 11-02-2015 by 5pm.  Failure to report will result in a straight time sentence.

Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 10-19-2017 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Restitution payable to MARK W. for $23,410.43 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.

Court does not suspend driving privileges.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Defendant Joseph Kozlowski in court with attorney Victor E Plantinga.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Defense requires additional time to complete discovery.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph Kozlowski in court with attorney Victor E Plantinga.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defense counsel that defendant has a pending case set for plea/sentencing in Branch 19 and requests to transfer that case to Br 33 for plea/sentencing with this case. Court will allow that case to be transferred to Branch 33.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Defendant has retained attorney Victor Plantinga.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Kozlowski in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant has picked up a new felony case.    The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 33.

All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Review hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Joseph Kozlowski in court with attorney Debra Patterson for attorney Alexis Liggins.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Letter of apology and restitutiton payment is submitted.  Review hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Joseph Kozlowski in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant needs to pay restitution and submit an apology letter.  Defendant has submitted a restitution payment.  Review hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Joseph Kozlowski in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that if he is convicted of this crime, he cannot possess any firearms or body armor.  Court advised defendant that if he is convicted of this crime, he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored. 

The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Brostrom, Branch 6 for a review hearing on 01-06-2015 at 1:30 PM.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
FILED, signed Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

Defendant Joseph Kozlowski in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties not ready to proceed with a DPA Hearing today.
Court approved request for an adjournment.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 11-06-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea Hearing/DPA.

Defendant Joseph Kozlowski in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today, however, the parties wish to proceed in a different manner.
Parties have agreed upon a DPA disposition, however, need more time to work out the details.
Parties request an adjournment.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 10-01-2014 at 1:30 PM for Projected Plea Hearing/DPA - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Defendant Joseph Kozlowski in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties still under negotiations.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 08-20-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing AND Restitution Hearing.

Defendant Joseph Kozlowski in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense requests a projected plea hearing date in 90 days.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 07-22-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2 Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing.

Defendant Joseph Kozlowski in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Tyrone St. Junior for Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-01-2014 at 01:30 pm.
